text:
You're learning with nine to five
English - business English for the workplace.

Hi Tim here with another 9 to
5 English lesson. In today's lesson we're

going to learn how to talk about
abilities. There are lots of

opportunities at work to talk about your
abilities and I don't just mean job

interviews. That's an obvious one but
there's also work planning project

meetings and just discussing who should
do what on a daily basis. I mean you're

not going to ask the person who doesn't
have the ability to type to prepare that

big report right the simplest way to
talk about basic abilities is using the

words can and be able to so you might
say I can type 60 words a minute

or I am able to type 60 words a minute
it's that simple

how about a bit of practice talking
about basic abilities let's try some

examples listen to each sentence then
repeat it for yourself ready let's get

started
I can use the full Microsoft Office
suite

Harriett is able to speak Japanese
fairly well

I'm pretty good at presentations in
public speaking

as you just practiced you can also say
you are good at something such as

presenting or bookkeeping that means you
have the ability in that area but what

if you're really good at something what
if your ability isn't basic but advanced

in that case you have a few options you
can say you excel at something which

means you're not just good at it but
excellent at it or you can say that some

ability is your greatest strength that
expression might be especially useful in

a job interview
let's give these expressions a try this

time
you're talking about things you're very

good at once again you're going to
repeat the examples after you hear them
I really excel at website design

one of my greatest strengths is managing
people

I'm really confident in my sales
abilities

did you notice that last example if you
say you're confident in some ability it

means you think you're very good at it
confidence is important so don't be

afraid to express it but being confident
doesn't mean saying you can do

everything there are some abilities you
don't have and how can we talk about

things we can't do well that word can't
is one way it's just the opposite of can

and the opposite of be able to is unable
to let's try these opposite expressions

to talk about things you cannot do I
can't understand this new software

I'm unable to stay focused during long
meetings
I'm not very good at presentations

great work you now have the ability to
talk about things you can and cannot do

but wait a second how can we talk about
past abilities I mean what if you were

good at something in the past but can't
do it anymore

the simplest way to talk about a past
ability is with the word could which is

the past of can for example when I was
in college I could learn new words very

easily you can also say you used to be
able to that used to expression is for

something that you did in the past but
not now how about a little practice for

talking about past abilities repeat the
examples after you hear them when I

lived in Spain I could speak Spanish
fluently

Quinn was good at Photoshop when he
first started here

I used to be able to work 60 hours a
week but not anymore

remember when we talked about being good
at something well in the past it's as

easy as saying you were good at it
and it's often helpful to say when you

could do something as you just practiced
okay now how does talking about

abilities sound in a conversation let's
find out with the short dialogue between

Shelley and Andrew Shelley is asking
Andrew about his language abilities so

tell me can you speak any foreign
languages yes I'm pretty good at French

and German I see and do you know any
Spanish no I'm unable to speak Spanish

as you heard Andrew is pretty good at
French and German but he's unable to

speak Spanish pretty simple right now
it's your turn to practice will repeat

the dialogue but this time we're going
to be bout the second speakers words you

will have to say those parts yourself
remember to start by saying that you're

pretty good at two languages then you'll
say you are unable to speak another

language here we go so tell me can you
speak any foreign languages
I see and do you know any Spanish

all right that about does it for this
lesson

we've learned some great ways to talk
about things you can or cannot do tune

in next time when you'll learn how to
ask for and give advice until then so
long and happy learning
